title: Objectification Theory-based Mathematical Activities for Improving Rational Number Recognition

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of fractional operations and measurement concepts
context.additional_context: Emphasizing social interaction and measurement activities to enable learners to apply mathematical thinking in daily life. Supplementary digital resources can be provided

learning_goals: Learners can explain the objective meaning of rational numbers through the process of comparing two sizes.
Learners can interpret the various meanings of fractions (ratios, part-whole relationships, quotients) through measurement.
Learners can recognize rational numbers in social interaction processes and apply them to mathematical problem-solving.

resources: Fraction and rational number comparison worksheet

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
